author: Special Correspondent
text:
A history-sheeter, U. Selvapandi, one of the accused in the Sunday’s murder of Madurai Corporation councillor K. Vijayaraghavan (42), surrendered before a court here on Monday.

Police said that Selvapandi, who had been detained under the Goondas Act last year, surrendered before Judicial Magistrate Court II. Teppakulam police had booked Selvapandi, his brothers U. Murugapandi and U. Manipandi and an unnamed accused in the murder that took place on Munichalai Road.

The deceased, representing ward 51 of Madurai Corporation was attacked by a gang and he sustained multiple stab injuries. He died on the way to the government hospital.

After the post-mortem, the body was handed over to the family members on Monday.

The police said that the brothers who had been supporting Vijayaraghavan in the ward, were disgruntled of late over the councillor not favouring them in getting some benefits through Corporation shops.

The police said that only after interrogating the surrendered accused and arresting others, they could establish the real motive for the murder.

Based on a complaint by Vijayaraghavan’s father Krishnamoorthy (64), Teppakulam police have registered a case of murder.
title: History-sheeter surrenders in councillor murder case
